text: The property of a fluid that is used to determine its suitability as a lubricant is its
The area under a velocity-time graph represents
In the absence of gravitational force, the weight of the body is
Which of the following propeties is not considered in choosing mercury as a thermomemetric liquid?
explanation:
Expansion and Contraction: The density of mercury affects how it expands and contracts with temperature changes. A liquid with a consistent and predictable expansion rate is essential for accurate temperature readings.Calibration: The density of the liquid must be known to calibrate the thermometer accurately. This ensures that the scale on the thermometer corresponds correctly to temperature changes.Thermal Conductivity: While conductivity can influence how quickly a liquid reaches thermal equilibrium with its surroundings, it is not as critical as density for the overall accuracy of the thermometer.
But in choosing mercury as a thermometric liquid, the density of mercury is not usually considered.

Two simple pendulum A and B of equal lengths and of masses 5g and 20g respectively are located in the same environment. The periods TA and TB of their respective oscillations are related by the equations
explanation: The period of a simple pendulum is dependent on the frequency. It is also dependent on the length of the pendulum but not the mass. Since the two pendulums have equal length, then their periods are equal as well.

Which of the following statements about anomalous expansion of water are correct?  i. There is contraction between 0oC and 4oC.  ii. There is expansion between 0oC and 100oC.  iii. The volume is minimum at 4oC.  iv. The volume is maximum at 4oC
Which of the following assumptions is not valid for an ideal gas ?

options.A: molecules of a particular gas are identical
options.B: molecules moves freely throughout the volume of the container
options.C: force of attraction between molecules is negligible
options.D: molecules move at constant speed between collisions

explanation: In an ideal gas, molecules do not move at constant speed between collisions. Their speeds vary due to elastic collisions with other molecules and the walls of the container. The other assumptions—identical molecules, free movement throughout the container, and negligible forces of attraction—are valid for an ideal gas.

text: Which of the following statements about the electromagnetic waves is correct?

options.A: radio waves have longer frequencies than x-rays
options.C: some of the waves travel at 3.0 x 108ms-1
options.D: white light occupies a region beyond ultraviolet rays

explanation:
All electromagnetic waves:are transverse waves;can travel through a vacuum ;travel at exactly the same speed in a vacuum, the speed of light, 300,000,000 m/s.
The common designations are radio waves, microwaves, infrared (IR), visible light, ultraviolet (UV) light, X-rays and gamma-rays.
ultraviolet rays lie beside violet of visible light and has a lesser frequency than visible light.
